text:
September 29, 19$h
✓
Mr. Leonard Marks
Cohn and Marks, Attorneys
Cafritz Building
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Leonard:
The attached letter, received by Frank Schooley here, was
given me in case it is felt that the NAEB might wish to voice
an opinion. Frank tells me that the University will not. I
have sent a copy of it to Cecil Bidlack to get his point of
view as an engineer. Meanwhile, do you think that, as the pro¬
fessional association of educational broadcasters, we should
file a brief?
Will hope that you will be attending our New York Conven¬
tion.
Sincerely,
Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
HJSscp
Enclosure
